conclusion: Determine the work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from C to A using the p-V diagram and initial conditions.
State A: P_A = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 2 L, T_A = 200 K; State B: P_B = 4 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 2 L; State C: P_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 5 L.
Process C to A is an isobaric process since P_C = P_A = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done during an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
Calculate ΔV: ΔV = V_A - V_C = 2 L - 5 L = -3 L.
Convert volume to cubic meters: ΔV = -3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate the work done: W = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (-3 x 10^-3 m^3) = -300 J.
The work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from C to A is -300 J.
